intro: Gilia tenuiflora subsp. interior, commonly known as the Interior Gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom in the summer months. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in open grasslands and sagebrush steppe.
